Sentence.value: Idiopathic thrombocytopenic purpura (ITP) is a bleeding disorder in which the immune system destroys platelets, which are necessary for normal blood clotting.
Sentence.pattern_crowdsource: [[Idiopathic thrombocytopenic purpura|C0043117]] (ITP) is a [[bleeding disorder|C1458140]] in which the immune system destroys platelets, which are necessary for normal blood clotting.

Sentence.value: Persons with the disease have too few platelets in the blood.
Sentence.pattern_crowdsource: [[Persons|C0027361]] with the [[disease|C0012634]] have too few platelets in the blood.

Sentence.value: ITP is sometimes called immune thrombocytopenic purpura or simply, immune thrombocytopenia.
Sentence.pattern_crowdsource: [[ITP|C0043117]] is sometimes called [[immune thrombocytopenic purpura|C0398650]] or simply, immune thrombocytopenia.
